question: Which among the following was a reason of eruption of Faraizi Movement?
option1: attacks of Christian Missionaries on Islam
option2: Oppression caused by Hindu Money lenders
option3: Oppressive Policy of the Company towards Muslim Tenants
answer: Oppressive Policy of the Company towards Muslim Tenants
explanation: The Faraizi movement was led by Haji Shariatullah in Eastern Bengal in 1819. The main objective of the movement was to stop un-Islamic practices and act upon the ritualistic and religious duties as Muslims. The movement took special attention to protect the rights of tenants.
